06 Nov 2019, 02:45

Een schietpartij aan een controlepost in de zuidelijke provincie Yala, kostte dinsdag aan minstens 15 mensen het leven. Vier anderen raakten gewond.
De daders gebruikten explosieven en verspreidden spijkers over de weg om een achtervolging te vermijden.

In de zuidelijke provincies Yala, Pattani en Narathi van het overwegend boeddhistische Thailand is de moslimbevolking in de meerderheid. Heavy separatist attack in Thailand

06 Nov 2019, 02:45

A shooting at a checkpoint in the southern province of Yala cost the lives of at least 15 people on Tuesday. Four others were injured.
The perpetrators used explosives and spread nails across the road to avoid a chase.
The Thai authorities talk about the largest armed attack in years. The violence was not claimed, but according to Colonel Pramote Promin, regional security spokesperson, there were probably insurgents at work.
In the southern provinces of Yala, Pattani and Narathi of predominantly Buddhist Thailand, the Muslim population is in the majority. The three provinces were part of an independent sultanate until Thailand annexed them in 1909. For some ten years, separatists have been leading an uprising that, according to the Deep South Watch monitoring group, has already claimed the lives of 7,000 people.
Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha has already strongly condemned the attack and ordered the authorities to quickly arrest the perpetrators.
